Package C482

Class ModifyProductFormController

  • java.lang.Object
    • C482.ModifyProductFormController
  • public class ModifyProductFormController
extends java.lang.Object
    This Class contains the methods and data that modify products from the Product Class
    Author:
    Patrick Denney

      • nameValid

        public boolean nameValid()
        Returns:
        Returns true if the name input contains valid data. If data is not valid, returns false, and displays an error dialog.

      • priceValid

        public boolean priceValid()
        Returns:
        Returns true if the price input contains valid data. If data is not valid, returns false, and displays an error dialog.

      • inventoryValid

        public boolean inventoryValid()
        Returns:
        Returns true if the inventory input contains valid data. If data is not valid, returns false, and displays an error dialog.

      • minLessThanMax

        public boolean minLessThanMax()
        Returns:
        Returns true if the minimum stock level is less than the Max stock level. Returns false if not, and displays an error message.

      • invBetweenMinMax

        public boolean invBetweenMinMax()
        Returns:
        Returns true if the inventory stock level is between than the max and min stock level. Returns false if not, and displays an error message.

      • styleClass

        private javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> styleClass​(javafx.scene.control.TextField field)
        This allows for a simple method to change the input field style on an error, to red and back again.
        Parameters:
        field - The text field targeted
        Returns:
        the field targeted styles class attribute

      • removeAllErrorFlags

        private void removeAllErrorFlags()
        Removes the red error style from all the text fields, when reattempting to save data.

      • getChangedProd

        public void getChangedProd​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Takes data from the input fields and validates it. If all data is valid, modifies the product with the new data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • findProductIndex

        public int findProductIndex​(int id)
        Parameters:
        id - the ID number of the product to be modified
        Returns:
        the index position of the product in the Inventory list.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Loads data from parts inventory to the respective tables, so that they can be added or removed from the product. Also, sets the input fields using the original product data.
